name: matrilineal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
In a matrilineal society or relationship, the fact of someone belonging to a particular family depends only on female relatives: Theirs is a matrilineal society where inheritance of the family property is passed to the youngest daughter. Many Native American tribes were matrilineal.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Indian state of Kerala has a matrilineal family system that encourages education and empowerment of women.Like many other groups in the area, descent and succession is matrilineal.These native societies traced their ancestry through matrilineal lines.
